title: Augusta: John P. Lightner to Kate Armentrout, May 18, 1861
summary: Lightner complains to Kate that excitement and preparations for the war have taken over the town of Lexington, interrupting classes at Washington College. He also describes some of the enlistment rallies and prayer meetings held in Lexington, and considers the possiblity that he will soon have to join the army as well.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Enlistment, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
